Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
BorgWarner PowerDrive Systems’ engineers develop and deploy innovative powertrain systems enabling the next generation of efficient, clean and intelligent drivetrain solutions. Our products must provide exceptional performance, efficiency and value in challenging safety- and security-critical environments. To accomplish this we’re looking for talented, passionate engineers who bring fresh ideas with their unique knowledge and experience to develop elegant solutions to these complex engineering problems.

This entry level cybersecurity engineer (CSE) works within the systems engineering function and is directly engaged with the development of secure, robust and resilient vehicle solutions for xEV projects. Those solutions range across hardware and software, including but not limited to immobilizers/anti-theft devices, manipulation detection system, secure boot methods, key storage and management, secure on-board communication and secure diagnostics, hardware trust anchors (microcontroller hardware security modules). This role supports the development team in ensuring all aspects of the stakeholder requirements are implemented and tested according to the latest automotive cybersecurity standards and best practices.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Job_Description:
Job purpose
BorgWarner PowerDrive Systems is currently looking for “dynamic, results driven” individual to join as a Embedded Software Staff Engineer. The Embedded Software Staff Engineer will be an individual with a solid electrical hardware and software background that can apply their skills within our High-performance global development team to implement production programming solutions.

Develop embedded CAN communications engines
Develop embedded FLASH programming engines
Develop embedded HSM programming engines

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Rhombus Energy Solutions a BorgWarner Company has an opportunity for a result oriented and driven Lead Embedded Software Engineer to join our team at our Dearborn, MI. This role will be responsible for supporting current product firmware development, implementation, and validation for DC Fast charger platforms. This individual will also be responsible for understanding and suggesting improvements to the embedded implementations. In addition, this role will work closely with third party vendors to support trouble shooting and resolution of 15118 related interoperability features and functionality.
Key Responsibilities:
Implement, test, and troubleshoot DC Fast Charger firmware for current product.
Create technical reports and audience appropriate summaries
Initiate and lead design reviews and technical discussions, including brainstorming.

Job_Description:
Lead SW Developer, Staff Engineer – Drivetrain Systems
BorgWarner DriveTrain Systems is currently looking for a “dynamic, results driven” individual to join as a Lead Software Developer – Staff Engineer in our Application Engineering organization at our Propulsion Technical Center (PTC) in Auburn Hills, MI.
In this role, the Lead Software Developer will lead, coach, and have responsibility for all technical aspects of embedded software design and development for our drivetrain electronic controls systems such as AWD products. In this position the incumbent will work with cross functional teams providing technical leadership and engineering guidance to support the execution of software development. They will work closely with our product engineers to ensure that BorgWarner’s program goals are met effectively.
Key Accountabilities:
Lead for specifying software development environment, infrastructure, tools, and methods

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
In this role, the Software System Requirements Engineer will be responsible for the management and coordination of software requirements for platform and production projects. This role is the interface to global platform stakeholders and is responsible for driving the derivation, decomposition, dissemination, and review of requirements in accordance with BorgWarner processes.
Key responsibilities
Create software requirements based on system or customer requirements
Ensure the accuracy and completeness of software requirements across features and projects.
Manage the requirements structure within the BorgWarner toolchain.
Ensure traceability between software, system, customer, and test requirements.
Assist project leadership to define release content and schedules.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
BorgWarner is a global product leader in propulsion solutions. We focus on developing leading powertrain technologies that improve fuel economy, emissions, and performance. Our facilities are located across the globe to provide local support for our diverse customer base.
BorgWarner is a company of independent thinkers who share a passion for the latest vehicle technology, enjoy working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment, and desire to play a key role in transforming the transportation landscape.
We engage this talented group of employees with meaningful work, amazing technologies, world-class facilities, and a culture that respects diversity and rewards excellence. It’s an atmosphere that fosters personal growth and allows you to propel your career to the next level.
Charging Product Engineer - Embedded Software
Job Description Summary
This role will expand the BorgWarner Morse Systems’ eProduct development talent and capabilities in support of the EV DC Fast Charger product line for North America. Product development could include internal development initiatives and collaboration initiative with external partners and government bodies such as the US Department of Energy. The Product Engineer will report to eProducts engineering manager.

Title: IT Business relationship manager
Job_Description:
IT Business Relationship Manager
Hybrid - Bellwood, IL

BorgWarner is seeking an IT Business Relationship Manager (BRM) in the Chicago region. The IT BRM will be responsible for partnering with key business stakeholders in delivering IT services and solutions. This person will report solid line to the regional IT BRM and dotted line to the plant manager(s) and will be responsible for developing relationships and actively engaging with the business in driving innovation and delivering IT value that is aligned with business objectives. This individual will also manage local IT budget and allocations.

From a regional perspective, you will collaborate with other BRMs and regional IT manager in creating and delivering an IT strategy that is aligned with the business priorities. Also, as part of a global organization, you will have opportunities to take on project based regional or global roles, those are excellent opportunities to expand your scope of work and develop your skills.

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Senior Systems Integration Engineer is responsible for ensuring the system integration processes and activities of integrating hardware & software is completed for an electrification project. This person will be responsible for fulfilling the system integration requirements and collaborating with the hardware and software teams throughout product development process, including setting up, troubleshooting, and testing the products to complete system integration for electrification products.
Key responsibilities
Responsible for developing system integration test strategy
Supporting development of system integration strategy
Responsible to perform Hardware & Software testing & prepare results
Supporting customer interface for any System Integration issues along with System Test Lead

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
The Application Engineer is the key technical customer facing contact that coordinates all system engineering related activities for a given customer program utilizing the local and global design, engineering and test resource.
POSITION SUMMARY:
Responsible for supporting customers by providing technical, design, and product application guidance to meet customer needs.
Application Engineers are the system architects. Our team members:
Take ownership of their programs and act as the technical leader for the team.
Are curious, have a thirst for learning, and strive to continually improve.
Seek to gain understanding through sound science, teamwork and determination.
Enjoy building and leading teams, comprised of people from all companies, areas, and levels, so that we can solve problems together.

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Rhombus Energy Solutions a BorgWarner Company has an opportunity for a result oriented and driven Lead Embedded Software Engineer to join our team at our Dearborn, MI. This role will be responsible for supporting current product firmware development, implementation, and validation for DC Fast charger platforms. This individual will also be responsible for understanding and suggesting improvements to the embedded implementations. In addition, this role will work closely with third party vendors to support trouble shooting and resolution of 15118 related interoperability features and functionality.
Key Responsibilities:
Implement, test, and troubleshoot DC Fast Charger firmware for current product.
Create technical reports and audience appropriate summaries
Initiate and lead design reviews and technical discussions, including brainstorming.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
In this role, the Software System Requirements Engineer will be responsible for the management and coordination of software requirements for platform and production projects. This role is the interface to global platform stakeholders and is responsible for driving the derivation, decomposition, dissemination, and review of requirements in accordance with BorgWarner processes.
Key responsibilities
Create software requirements based on system or customer requirements
Ensure the accuracy and completeness of software requirements across features and projects.
Manage the requirements structure within the BorgWarner toolchain.
Ensure traceability between software, system, customer, and test requirements.
Assist project leadership to define release content and schedules.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Job Description
BorgWarner PowerDrive Systems’ engineers develop and deploy innovative powertrain systems enabling the next generation of efficient, clean and intelligent drivetrain solutions. Our products must provide exceptional performance, efficiency and value in challenging safety- and security-critical environments. To accomplish this we’re looking for talented, passionate engineers who bring fresh ideas with their unique knowledge and experience to develop elegant solutions to these complex engineering problems.
The cybersecurity engineer works within the systems engineering function and is directly engaged with the development of secure, robust and resilient vehicle solutions for xEV projects. Those solutions range across hardware and software, including but not limited to immobilizers/anti-theft devices, manipulation detection system, secure boot methods, key storage and management, secure on-board communication and secure diagnostics, hardware trust anchors (microcontroller hardware security modules). The CSE supports the development team in ensuring all aspects of the stakeholder requirements are implemented and tested according to the latest automotive cybersecurity standards and best practices.

Internal Use Only: Salary

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Rhombus Energy Solutions a BorgWarner Company is a leader in the exciting market of electric vehicle charging systems as well as advanced applications for power conversion systems such as inverters and microgrids. Rhombus is a growing company with a results-oriented culture that compels excellence, agility, and the desire to move quickly and precisely to seize opportunities. Our environment is both challenging and supportive we give employees the opportunity to develop their skills and do their best work.
Job Duties
Evaluates existing manufacturing processes by conducting research programs; applying knowledge of product design, assembly, tooling, and materials; conferring with equipment vendors; soliciting observations from technicians and identify areas for improvement.
Develops manufacturing processes by studying product requirements; researching, designing, modifying, and testing manufacturing methods and equipment; conferring with equipment vendors.

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Global Senior Systems Engineer
JOB DESCRIPTION & KEY RESPONSABILITIES
The candidate will quickly become a key member of the team while learning about multiple exhaust sensor models developed as solutions in an ever changing world of environmental regulations.
The candidate will report to one of our Sensor Engineering Managers challenged with delivering controller solutions for both Diesel and gasoline sensor models. If you enjoy the hands-on experience of creating, testing, and improving product performance through effective systems design, this is the job for you!
Translate stakeholder requirements into system and component requirements and specifications
Design efficient logic algorithms and state machines to manage and control automotive exhaust sensors.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
Job purpose
Join BorgWarner to help accelerate the world’s transition to hybrid and electric vehicles. You will be part of a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic team developing products to support BorgWarner’s vision of a clean, energy-efficient world. As a System Development Engineer, you will support the development of high voltage automotive products including high voltage coolant heaters for Electrical Vehicles and Hybrid Electric Vehicles. As part of Emissions, Thermal & Turbo Systems, you will be a member of a cross-functional global team (primarily USA, Spain, Germany, China) participating in the design, testing, and validation of products for OEM customers.
Key responsibilities
Support the engineering development of new and modified high voltage automotive products for hybrid and electric vehicles
Execute tasks associated with the development and testing of the product at the system level including activities associated with electrical hardware, software, mechanical and functional safety

Job_Description:
BorgWarner Morse Systems in Ithaca, New York has multiple opportunities for engineering co-ops. The Co-op Program is dedicated to fostering fulfilling experiences that develop each student’s talent; transforming them into the outstanding professionals of tomorrow. We value each co-op’s creativity, depend on their passion to succeed and believe in the difference they can make. Above all, The Co-op Program provides the opportunity for each person to perform as a valuable player in their department’s team, within a stimulating, challenging and supportive environment.
Employment blocks typically vary from 6-9 months based on performance and company needs. Applicants must be fulltime students studying within an applicable engineering field and available to work fulltime hours on the Ithaca, NY campus.
Typical Positions Available:
Manufacturing Engineering
Product Engineering

Job_Description:
System Development Engineer – Emissions, Thermal, & Turbo Systems
Job purpose
Join BorgWarner to help accelerate the world’s transition to hybrid and electric vehicles. You will be part of a diverse, fast-paced and dynamic team developing products to support BorgWarner’s vision of a clean, energy-efficient world. As part of Emissions, Thermal & Turbo Systems, you will lead a cross-functional global team (primarily USA, Spain, Germany, China) in the design, testing, and validation of products for OEM customers.

Lead the engineering development of new and modified high voltage automotive products for hybrid and electric vehicles

Title: Embedded Systems/Software Engineer, Cybersecurity
Job_Description:
The Product Engineer, Mechanical – Lead NBO/Platform will be responsible for concept development work of driveline/gearbox components, sub-assemblies, and mechanical integration of integrated Drive Modules (iDMs) focusing on New Business opportunities (NBO) and Platform engineering projects. In addition, Product Engineer, Mechanical – Lead NBO/Platform will perform concept CAD work including but not limited to 3D/2D generation, BOM generation, GD&T and stack analysis to deliver drawings and models per expected timing and milestones.
Generate gearbox architecture for iDMs for concept development in NBO and platform projects; including integration of mechanical gearbox components, eMotor, power electronics and lubrication mechanisms
Understand mechanical requirements for iDM assembly and facilitate decomposition to component teams; submit component design requests
Collaborate with relevant functional teams (systems, component, eMotor, electronics, CAD/CAE, program management, operations, sales, manufacturing, etc.) to complete deliverables of the concept development work

Title: Advanced Engineering - Data Science Engineer
Job_Description:
Position Summary

This position is in the Corporate Advanced Technology Development team, which is a part of the Chief Technology Officer organization and is based at BorgWarner’s Propulsion Technology Center (PTC).

This team is responsible for the development and demonstration of advanced mobility technologies, focusing on new growth areas with longer time horizons; the development is system-oriented, and involves collaboration with other functional areas and business units at BorgWarner, as well as with external technology partners.

As a member of the Corporate Advanced Technology Development team, you will be responsible for utilizing your data analytics, machine learning and systems engineering expertise in supporting the design, development and validation of new mobility technologies. You will support the development and evaluation of technologies in simulation, in hardware-in-the-loop set-ups, and in-vehicle.
Internal Use Only: Salary

Title: Business Process & Data Analyst
Job_Description:
POSITION SUMMARY
The Business Process & Data Analyst will be a subject matter expert for all Global Supply Chain Management (GSM) business processes, systems and tools that includes but not limited to: developing systems and process roadmap, collaborating with enterprise data analytics team and other reporting units (RU) supply chain teams on various business processes. Additionally, to ensure data accuracy and integrity. This position reports to the Director of Business Process, Data Analytics & VAE and can located in the Unites States or Europe.
Department: Global Supply Chain
Reports To: Director of Business Process, Data Analytics & VAE
Job Title: Business Process & Data Analyst

Level: 13
